intro: Cynoglossum turcomanicum, commonly known as Turkmenian tongue-shaped flower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tongue-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Cynoglossum turcomanicum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
